channel.title: Portforwarding Help
channel.description:
As the title says i need help in portforwarding in my router . PORT: 43594 but i don't know how. I watched some videos but i can't find how to portforward my Router i'm giving you 2 Pics.
[b]This is the first one this is when i type my username and password (I know user and pass)[/b] https://www.dropbox.com/s/tbllwziwehqj0fs/login%20page.bmp [b]This is when i log in. So where can i portforward ?[/b] https://www.dropbox.com/s/qik6tr3ixwnvofz/inside.bmp

item.title: Portforwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“eri0nn, post:1, topic:470779”]As the title says i need help in portforwarding in my router . PORT: 43594 but i don’t know how.
I watched some videos but i can’t find how to portforward my Router i’m giving you 2 Pics.

This is the first one this is when i type my username and password (I know user and pass)

This is when i log in. So where can i portforward ?

Dropbox

Dropbox - Error

Dropbox is a free service that lets you bring your photos, docs, and videos anywhere and share them easily. Never email yourself a file again!


You can try to use this nifty tool here but I warn you, it doesn’t have all routers. It also comes with a built in port checker, that’s 100x better then canyouseeme.org, and it also doesn’t need your server to be online to check.

item.title: Portforwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @khayam khayam
item.description:
@khayam wrote:

use this site: http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm
and find your router name and model, also it has pictures and clear instructions on how to portforward correctly.
Hope it helps

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @eri0nn eri0nn
item.description:
@eri0nn wrote:

[quote=“soulfear1234, post:2, topic:470779”]Ok first go on advenced…
1 - Click Virtual Server
2 - Name : Rshost Ip: Ur internet ip like 192.168.0.100 (example) Port public: 43594 Port Private : 43594
3 - Make shure u check it
4 - Click save
5 - Go in port portforwarding
6 - Do the same thing twice…Once Traffic type : TCP and the other one UDP
7 - Make shure u check in the little square…
8 - save and thats it…[/quote]
I go on Advanced tab but i can’t find Virtual Server.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

Also when u check on a website like canyouseeme.org or sumthing make sure that your source is runing.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Help
item.dc:creator: @soulfear1234 soulfear1234
item.description:
@soulfear1234 wrote:

Ok first go on advenced…
1 - Click Virtual Server
2 - Name : Rshost Ip: Ur internet ip like 192.168.0.100 (example) Port public: 43594 Port Private : 43594
3 - Make shure u check it
4 - Click save
5 - Go in port portforwarding
6 - Do the same thing twice…Once Traffic type : TCP and the other one UDP
7 - Make shure u check in the little square…
8 - save and thats it…

Read full topic
